Here's a detailed guide on how to assemble a desktop computer: First, gather all necessary components such as the motherboard, CPU, RAM, storage, power supply, and case. Follow the manufacturer's instructions to install the CPU onto the motherboard, apply thermal paste, attach the CPU cooler, insert RAM modules into the slots, mount the motherboard in the case, connect power supply cables, install storage devices, and finally, double-check all connections before powering on. For safety and compatibility, refer to the manuals and consider seeking professional help if you're unfamiliar with hardware assembly.
